acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.36microg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >=5,000mg/kg, together with the absence of mortality (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1987)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification not possible because there is no evidence of death at the highest dose of 2.3mg/kg in rat inhalation exposure studies, and the acute toxicity value cannot be determined (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1997)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 253mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1998)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no treatment-related increase in tumor incidence observed in mouse and rat carcinogenicity studies, reported in Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1988, 1989)). Also due to the fact that the substance is classified as Group 3 by IARC (1987) and Group A4 by ACGIH (2001).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (log Kow=0.51(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 77-81degC, Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as flammable according to ICSC (2004). Classified intoo Division 6.1 (UN#2783 Organophosphorous Pesticide, solid, toxic (ICSC (2004)) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data on in vivo mouse micronucleus tests and in vivo mouse dominant lethal tests, though in vitro reverse mutation tests and in vitro chromosome aberration tests showed positive (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1987)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though being organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) bound to the elements other than carbon and hydrogen

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2783 Organophosphorous Pesticide, solid, toxic (ICSC (2004)) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the evidence of reduced neonatal body weight, reduced female fertility index, reduced number of litters, and delayed ossification in the pups at doses producing reduced body weight gains in parental animals observed in rat 3-generation reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1987)). Since it cannot be clearly demonstrated that these findings are secondary to parental toxicity, the substance is classified into Category 2.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2783 Organophosphorous Pesticide, solid, toxic (ICSC (2004)) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: In the available rabbit eye irritation studies, 3 test animals exhibited a score of 2 (conjunctival redness noticed at 24 hours), but the reactions fully cleared up on day 7 (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1987)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on no evidence of skin irritation reported in more than one skin irritation studies with rabbits (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1986, 1987)).

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the report on guinea pig Maximization tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1987)): "skin sensitization: positive."

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water (water solubility: 120g/L (20degC), Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In rat repeated dose toxicity studies, cholinesterase inhibition was observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2. However, classification is not possible because no evidence of other common symptoms or pathological findings was available (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1956)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In rat single dose toxicity studies, clinical signs and symptoms including reduced motor activity, tremors, salivation and lacrimation were reported (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1987)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.
